skill.name: code-reviewer

Includes automated code analysis, best practice checking, security scanning, and review checklist generation. Use when reviewing pull requests, providing code feedback, identifying issues, or ensuring code quality standards.

security_audit.summary: All 67 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The analyzer misidentified TypeScript template literals in markdown documentation as shell backtick execution, common text headers as weak cryptographic algorithms, and standard markdown sections as system reconnaissance. The actual Python scripts contain only safe file operations with user-specified output paths. No malicious patterns confirmed.

content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill provides automated code analysis, security vulnerability detection, and standardized checklists across TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Swift, Kotlin, and Go projects.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes pull requests and code changes for quality issues
Checks code against security best practices and vulnerability patterns
Generates standardized review checklists for multiple languages
Produces detailed reports with prioritized improvement recommendations
Supports TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Swift, Kotlin, and Go
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Cannot access private repositories or CI/CD systems
Analysis is static and does not cover runtime behavior
Relies on user-provided code paths and context

use_cases.title: Review pull requests
use_cases.description: Get automated feedback on code changes before merging to catch issues early.

use_cases.title: Enforce code standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all submitted code meets team quality and security guidelines.

use_cases.title: Scale review capacity
use_cases.description: Handle more contributions efficiently with automated first-pass review.

prompt_templates.title: Basic code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the code at [file-path] for quality issues, security vulnerabilities, and adherence to best practices. Report your findings.

prompt_templates.title: Pull request review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the code-reviewer skill to analyze the pull request changes in [repo-path]. Focus on security, performance, and maintainability. Summarize the key findings.

prompt_templates.title: Full project audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a comprehensive code review on the project at [project-path]. Generate a detailed report with checklist items, security issues, and improvement recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Security focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security-focused code review on [target-path]. Identify potential vulnerabilities, insecure patterns, and security best practice violations.

output_examples.input: Review the TypeScript file at src/utils/auth.ts for quality and security issues.
output:
## Code Review Summary

**File:** src/utils/auth.ts

**Overall Assessment:** Needs improvement - 3 medium issues found

### Security Findings
- Consider using constant-time comparison for password validation to prevent timing attacks
- Ensure JWT secret is properly validated before use

### Quality Issues
- Function exceeds 50 lines - consider splitting into smaller helpers
- Missing input validation on public-facing function parameters

### Recommendations
- Add unit tests for authentication edge cases
- Consider extracting token parsing logic to separate module

output_examples.input: Analyze the Python API endpoints for common vulnerabilities.
output:
## Security Review Report

**Target:** api/endpoints/

### Critical Issues
None detected

### Medium Priority
- 2 instances of string concatenation in SQL queries - use parameterized queries
- Missing rate limiting on authentication endpoint

### Best Practice Violations
- Inconsistent error handling across endpoints
- Missing request validation schemas

### Suggested Checklist
- [ ] Implement parameterized queries
- [ ] Add request validation middleware
- [ ] Review authentication flow for edge cases

output_examples.input: Review the Go service for performance issues.
output:
## Performance Review Report

**Target:** services/payment/

### Performance Issues
- Database queries in hot loop - consider caching
- Missing connection pooling configuration
- Unnecessary memory allocations in critical path

### Optimization Opportunities
- Add Redis caching layer for frequently accessed data
- Implement batch operations for bulk inserts
- Use sync.Pool for object reuse

### Recommendations
- Profile with pprof to identify bottlenecks
- Consider connection pool sizing adjustments
- Review indexing strategy for query patterns

best_practices: Run the code reviewer before every pull request to catch issues early
Use the generated checklists as a starting point and add team-specific items
Combine automated analysis with manual review for critical security areas
anti_patterns: Skipping review on small changes - most bugs hide in minor modifications
Ignoring style warnings - they often indicate deeper architectural issues
Using automated review as the only review step - human judgment remains essential

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Swift, Kotlin, and Go are fully supported.

faq.question: Does this skill execute the code it reviews?
faq.answer: No, this is a static analysis tool. It does not run or test the code.

faq.question: Can it integrate with GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes local code paths. Integration requires additional setup.

faq.question: How does it detect security vulnerabilities?
faq.answer: It checks for known vulnerable patterns like SQL injection, hardcoded secrets, and weak cryptography.

faq.question: Can I customize the review checklist?
faq.answer: The skill uses built-in checklists. Custom rules require modifying the reference documentation.

faq.question: Is this suitable for production code reviews?
faq.answer: Yes, but treat it as a first-pass tool. Always follow up with manual expert review.
